field.name: Status
field.definition: the level of acceptance of a metadata record in a repository

levelAndDeftn.levelDeftn: the level of acceptance of a metadata record in a repository; see the allowed combination of terms below

terms.termAndDeftn: the metadata record is accessible the catalog/library/repository
the metadata record is not accessible in the catalog/library/repository
the metadata record is temporarily inaccessible in the catalog/library/repository
the metadata record was edited by the collection builder and it is now again at the catalog/library/repository awaiting a decision about whether it will be accessioned
the metadata record is at the catalog/library/repository and is awaiting a decision about whether it will be accessioned
the metadata record does not have an official categorization and should be treated as a potential record
the metadata record exists but may be incomplete or new and the catalog/library/repository should treat it as a potential record
a cataloger of the collection is actively working with the metadata record
the metadata record is generally complete and operationally works in the catalog/library/repository but some information may still need editing or updating

dos.practice: A metadata record can only have one status. So use a single status term.
Choose the status that best describes the cataloging state of the metadata record.
If using a DLESE cataloging tool, this field should probably not be edited without consulting DLESE or the primary collection builder.
If a status of Holding or Deaccessioned is used, be sure to provide a reason in the status information field.

examples.practice: Holding: The resource is placed into holding because its URL is broke
Deaccessioned: The resource is deaccessioned because the its server is permanently offline.
Accessioned: The resource is accessioned because it meets accessioning polices and metadata best practices.
